body: On closer inspection this isn't an acorn issue. Playing with it provided the expected results, and putting a breakpoint [here](https://github.com/rollup/rollup/blob/b50167646efe19297b40de49f19caebe2eb77018/src/Module.js#L297) just after we get the ast and inspecting it shows correct offsets. It gets jumbled in the way somewhere. I'll see if I can track down where.
@Zirak that's what I found, too. I added your example as a test in rollup's test suite and it behaves as you describe. I'll try to track it down too, but let me know if you find it first.

![I think I've got it](http://cdn.staticneo.com/w/layton/thumb/1/10/LukeCorrect.png/180px-LukeCorrect.png)

Found it @eventualbuddha. The range of references are declared [in `Reference.js`](https://github.com/rollup/rollup/blob/b50167646efe19297b40de49f19caebe2eb77018/src/Reference.js#L19-L20), and are then modified [in `SyntheticNamespaceDeclaration`](https://github.com/rollup/rollup/blob/51a87a85c9c8f9b11b65cf08f713367fd195193c/src/Declaration.js#L198-L200), where we find a quite appropriate `TODO`. Only the names and the periods separating names are taken into account, not the whitespace.

issue.title: Rewrite an entire member expression for namespace imports.

body: Thanks for the help, @Zirak. This should be fixed in #566.
Neat, thanks! I was starting to play with `Reference#parts`, making it an array of nodes instead of strings. You seem to have saved me some time.
